summary: This document is a subpoena issued to Western Union for records related to money transfers involving Jeffrey E. Epstein. It outlines the requirements for the search of records from January 1, 2004, to the present date and specifies the locations in Florida where the transfers occurred.

persons.name: Gino Silvestri
persons.context: Gino Silvestri is the agent from the Money Laundering Task Force who issued the subpoena to Western Union for records related to Jeffrey E. Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the individual whose money transfer records are being subpoenaed by the State Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Sharon Bock
persons.context: Sharon Bock is the Clerk of Court who issued the subpoena and affixed the court seal.

connections.description: Gino Silvestri is investigating Jeffrey E. Epstein in relation to money laundering activities.

events.title: Issuance of Subpoena
events.description: A subpoena was issued to Western Union for records related to Jeffrey E. Epstein's money transfers.

locations: 20 Corporate Hills Drive, St. Charles, MO
keyFacts: The subpoena was issued on March 15, 2006, to Western Union for records related to Jeffrey E. Epstein.
The records requested include all information related to money transfers from January 1, 2004, to the present.
Gino Silvestri is the agent responsible for the subpoena as part of the Money Laundering Task Force.
Sharon Bock is the Clerk of Court who issued the subpoena.
The subpoena requires Western Union to provide detailed records of money transfers involving Epstein across multiple Florida locations.
